title: TC001-Autenticação com credenciais válidas
description: Verifica se o sistema autentica corretamente o usuário com credenciais válidas e atribui o perfil correto com sessão persistente.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input valid email and password for Gestor POP profile and click login button
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid email for Gestor POP profile
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('gestorpop@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password for Gestor POP profile
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('SenhaValida123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Failed: Invalid Credentials').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The system did not authenticate the user correctly with valid credentials or did not assign the Gestor POP profile with a persistent session as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-Falha na autenticação com credenciais inválidas
description: Verifica que o sistema rejeita o login com credenciais incorretas e exibe mensagem amigável de erro.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Find and click the element to navigate to the login page.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 300)
        

        # -> Input incorrect email and password, then click the login button.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input incorrect email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('usuario_incorreto@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input incorrect password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('senha_incorreta')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Entrar' button to attempt login with incorrect credentials
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Email ou senha incorretos').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        # --> Assertions to verify final state

        except AssertionError:

The test plan execution failed because unauthorized access was detected or the security restrictions were not properly enforced.')

description: Testa se a navegação por abas e aplicação de filtros no dashboard atualiza os dados exibidos dentro do tempo máximo aceitável (<500ms).
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Locate and click on the first tab in the dashboard to test navigation and measure load time.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 300)
        

        # -> Input email and password, then click login button to access dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testuser@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('TestPassword123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click login button to submit credentials
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Dashboard loaded in under 500ms').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Navigation between dashboard tabs and application of filters did not update the data within the acceptable maximum time of 500ms.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC013-Acesso restrito: tentar acessar funcionalidade sem permissão
description: Confirma que usuários sem permissão para uma função específica não conseguem acessá-la e recebem mensagem apropriada.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Authenticate with a user with profile Gerente de Seção
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the alert div if it is a login or authentication prompt to start authentication process
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill email and password fields with Gerente de Seção user credentials and click Entrar button
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for Gerente de Seção user
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('gerente.secao@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for Gerente de Seção user
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('senhaSegura123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to authenticate
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Retry login with correct Gerente de Seção user credentials
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input correct email for Gerente de Seção user
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('gerente.secao@validemail.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input correct password for Gerente de Seção user
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('senhaCorreta123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to authenticate
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Granted to Gestor POP Module').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Users without permission (Gerente de Seção) should not access the Gestor POP module and must see an access denied message.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC014-Componente UI reutilizável: consistência visual e funcionalidade do botão
description: Verifica que o componente de botão reutilizável exibe estado correto (hover, disabled) e executa ações esperadas em múltiplas telas.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to locate reusable buttons in forms and dashboards
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 400)
        

        # -> Test hover state on the 'Entrar' button to verify visual change
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Focus on the 'Entrar' button to simulate hover state
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Test hover state on the 'Entrar' button to verify visual style changes
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Focus on 'Entrar' button to simulate hover state
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Botão Reutilizável Teste Falhou').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Falha no teste: O componente de botão reutilizável não exibiu o estado correto (hover, disabled) ou não executou as ações esperadas em múltiplas telas conforme o plano de teste.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC015-Logout e encerramento de sessão
description: Garantir que o usuário consegue efetuar logout corretamente, encerrando a sessão e redirecionando para página de login.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Authenticate the user by navigating to login page and filling credentials
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Input valid email and password and submit login form
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid email in email field
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('user@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password in password field
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('correct_password')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Logout Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=5000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The logout process did not complete successfully. The session was not properly ended or the user was not redirected to the login page as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
